Hi! I'm a new contributor — I've opened #35467, which adds Schreier graphs, Cayley graphs, and Cayley sum graphs to Mathlib.

The PR takes a quiver-based approach (building on the Lean 3 PR leanprover-community/mathlib3#18693) to get directed, edge-labeled graphs with covering maps, connectivity, and vertex-transitivity. It also includes Cayley sum graphs as a separate SimpleGraph construction for additive combinatorics.

This complements Edward's #35084, which generalizes circulantGraph to mulCayley/addCayley on the SimpleGraph side.

I'd really appreciate any review or feedback — happy to split the PR or restructure if that helps.
Thanks!
Although you don't mention it here, the work is heavily AI-assisted and over 1000 lines long.

Hello, can you clarify The code has been reviewed by the author and their advisor.?
Both links in the docstring of CayleySumGraph.lean are fake:

* [Chung, Graham - "Quasi-random graphs with given degree sequences"](https://www.math.ucsd.edu/~fan/wp/degree.pdf)
* [Green - "Counting sets with small sumset"](https://arxiv.org/abs/math/0304475)

The first one is 404, and the second one has nothing to do with what you claim it is, and isn't authored by Green.
Are these hallucinations? And can you clarify whether the statement The code has been reviewed by the author and their advisor. was written by you or by the AI, given that the PR description looks AI generated?

Are these hallucinations? And can you clarify whether the statement The code has been reviewed by the author and their advisor. was written by you or by the AI, given that the PR description looks AI generated?

Thank you for catching this and for the thorough review. I'm sorry about this. Those two references are fake — they were AI-generated and I failed to verify them before submitting. That's entirely my fault.

To answer your questions directly: yes, I used AI extensively in writing this PR, including the docstrings where those references appeared. The PR description was also AI-assisted. The statement “The code has been reviewed by the author and their advisor.” was written by me and is accurate — my advisor and I did review the code together — but neither of us checked the references and docstrings carefully enough.

I'm removing the fake references now and will carefully audit the rest of the PR for any other issues I missed.

The second reference is probably https://arxiv.org/abs/math/0304183 Counting sets with small sumset, and the clique number of random Cayley graphs or https://arxiv.org/abs/1305.3079 Counting sets with small sumset and applications

Jeremy Tan said:

Thank you — that's the correct reference, I'll update the PR.
